physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complete loss of ambulation and confinement to wheelchair. Muscle weakness has progressed to the facial, neck flexors, and swallowing muscles. Trace of movement remaining in finger flexors. Quadriceps muscle shows adequate bulk and normal strength with preserved knee jerks.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weakness progressed since the initial evaluation 8 years prior. Initially, the quadriceps muscle was mildly abnormal; follow-up biopsy indicates marked myopathic features with vacuoles 8 years later, despite clinical sparing.
